result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gaspar Gonzalez-Santiago

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gaspar Gonzalez-Santiago in court.  Attorney John Stephen Joyce in court for Gaspar Gonzalez-Santiago.  Prosecuting attorney Tyler Rubenzer in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final Pretrial held. Court holds colloquy with parties. State placed offer on the record. Case may resolve. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 13. 
Due to the 12/5/2022 Jury Trial being scheduled on a miscellaneous week, Court rescheduled the Jury Trial to 1/23/2023.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse. 
Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Defense's Notice of Motion and Motion for Orders in Limine, filed.

Defendant Gaspar Gonzalez-Santiago in court with attorney John Stephen Joyce.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court with 21CM2261. For reasons placed on the record, defense counsel requests interpreter be waived. Court grants interpreter to be waived for this hearing.
Case in court on State's Joinder Motion. Motion hearing Proceeded. Defense does not object.
Court GRANTED State's joinder motion for reasons placed on the record. Cases are joined for trial.
Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  
  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Gaspar Gonzalez-Santiago in court with attorney John Stephen Joyce.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Spanish interpreter waived for the purpose of these proceedings. Case in court for a Status. Defendant has a pending matter  (21CM2261) before the court, which has been adjourned. This case to follow. Case remains calendared in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MDAG and members of her family. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Gaspar Gonzalez-Santiago in court with attorney John Stephen Joyce.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as interpreter: Patrick Ryan 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 050198,
Payable Number: 1009392,
Receipt Number: 22RP021606,
Amount: $20.00

Attorney John Joyce called to infrom the court that he could not appear this afternoon and he did not want his client to do the initial appearance by himself. Court date for 5/19/2022 has been vacated. Case is adjourned to 5/25/2022, at 1:30 p.m.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/19/2022@230p
